intro: Canthium hainanense, commonly known as Hainan spurge or Hainan canthium, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of China, particularly Hainan Island. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with simple, opposite leaves that are usually ovate or elliptic in shape. Its flowers are small and clustered in cup-shaped inflorescences, and the fruit is a three-winged capsule that splits open to release seeds. Canthium hainanense is adapted to humid, warm climates and is often found in forested areas or along stream banks.
